item.title: When will there ever be a server like 2004-2006 released
item.dc:creator: @ziplock ziplock
item.description:
@ziplock wrote:

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:15, topic:441118”][quote author=drubrkletern link=topic=543794.msg3986409#msg3986409 date=1335927102]
OT
NO THERE WILL NEVER BE A SERVER LIKE 2004-2006 RELEASED
[/quote]
You can’t say something so confidently. It makes you seem ignorant.

I don’t believe that intelligent people will ever band together in order to recreate the era, but I do believe it is possible. However, it took Jagex 5 years of server development with a large, highly qualified team, so a much larger amount of work would be needed than what anyone has exerted so far.[/quote]

Well seeing as we already have all of the models and ideas, more than half the work has already been done without even having to touch any code.

item.source: When will there ever be a server like 2004-2006 released

item.title: When will there ever be a server like 2004-2006 released
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“dain bramage, post:19, topic:441118”][quote author=eyeownyew link=topic=543794.msg3986472#msg3986472 date=1335934337]

OT
NO THERE WILL NEVER BE A SERVER LIKE 2004-2006 RELEASED

You can’t say something so confidently. It makes you seem ignorant.

I don’t believe that intelligent people will ever band together in order to recreate the era, but I do believe it is possible. However, it took Jagex 5 years of server development with a large, highly qualified team, so a much larger amount of work would be needed than what anyone has exerted so far.
[/quote]
The client would have taken up the majority of the developers time. You also need to remember that recreating RS in 2006 would require documentation on the entire game from that era. You cannot trust sources such as RSWiki as they change previous articles to be updated to the current revision and to my knowledge, there is no public archive. You can get close from viewing the thousands of videos and images from the time, but you cannot get it perfect. So generally speaking, with a team of experienced developers, it could only take a few months to get to the point of being basically the same - but not exactly the same. Btw, if I’m wrong in any of this, I’d like to be corrected.[/quote]
completely true, but the developers would have to dedicate their entire time to it over those months. there would also have to be a team of devs (hence plural)

Read full topic

And rep means nothing tbh i see people with 200 rep can’t solve simple problem lmao

Rep has some meaning to this community, those with lower rep aren’t trusted compared to those with a reputation of 200.
How often do you see somebody with 200 reputation releasing a virus in the server downloads? Can’t say I’ve seen that in a long long time while people with under 60 rep are attempting to infect members of the community everyday in the server downloads section by releasing a virus in there source.
[/quote]
They want them roonescape gpz.[/quote]
They’re probably paying Mexicans to hack for them because they’re probably too fat and lazy to do it themselves anyway.

item.title: When will there ever be a server like 2004-2006 released
item.dc:creator: @eyeownyew Eyeownyew
item.description:
@eyeownyew wrote:

[quote=“dain bramage, post:19, topic:441118”][quote author=eyeownyew link=topic=543794.msg3986472#msg3986472 date=1335934337]

OT
NO THERE WILL NEVER BE A SERVER LIKE 2004-2006 RELEASED

You can’t say something so confidently. It makes you seem ignorant.

I don’t believe that intelligent people will ever band together in order to recreate the era, but I do believe it is possible. However, it took Jagex 5 years of server development with a large, highly qualified team, so a much larger amount of work would be needed than what anyone has exerted so far.
[/quote]
The client would have taken up the majority of the developers time. You also need to remember that recreating RS in 2006 would require documentation on the entire game from that era. You cannot trust sources such as RSWiki as they change previous articles to be updated to the current revision and to my knowledge, there is no public archive. You can get close from viewing the thousands of videos and images from the time, but you cannot get it perfect. So generally speaking, with a team of experienced developers, it could only take a few months to get to the point of being basically the same - but not exactly the same. Btw, if I’m wrong in any of this, I’d like to be corrected.[/quote]

RuneScape Wiki

2006

This is a list of updates that occured in RuneScape in 2006. December 20 December A Christmas Reminder, A Christmas Reminder 19 December Fake websites, Fake websites 18 December Cards, letters and area guides Christmas Update!, Cards, letters and...

It gives general ideas of what updates there were in 2006. If you click on the updates, it gives you the link to the exact change “documentation”. On the bottom there is also an index showing all of the years Runescape has been around, and you can look at the previous years so you know what to add. It would be a pain to do it, but I can imagine that this is the best public database of all Runescape updates/content.

Read full topic

item.title: When will there ever be a server like 2004-2006 released
item.dc:creator: @dain_bramage dain bramage
item.description:
@dain_bramage wrote:

[quote=“eyeownyew, post:15, topic:441118”][quote author=drubrkletern link=topic=543794.msg3986409#msg3986409 date=1335927102]
OT
NO THERE WILL NEVER BE A SERVER LIKE 2004-2006 RELEASED
[/quote]
You can’t say something so confidently. It makes you seem ignorant.

I don’t believe that intelligent people will ever band together in order to recreate the era, but I do believe it is possible. However, it took Jagex 5 years of server development with a large, highly qualified team, so a much larger amount of work would be needed than what anyone has exerted so far.[/quote]
The client would have taken up the majority of the developers time. You also need to remember that recreating RS in 2006 would require documentation on the entire game from that era. You cannot trust sources such as RSWiki as they change previous articles to be updated to the current revision and to my knowledge, there is no public archive. You can get close from viewing the thousands of videos and images from the time, but you cannot get it perfect. So generally speaking, with a team of experienced developers, it could only take a few months to get to the point of being basically the same - but not exactly the same. Btw, if I’m wrong in any of this, I’d like to be corrected.
